DataElement.preferredName: Patient Stratum Group Enrolled Have Inflammatory Bowel Disease Obstruction Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A question which asks whether or not a patient enrolled in stratum number specified in the study has chronic inflammatory bowel disease and/or bowel obstruction.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Stratum Group Enrolled Have Inflammatory Bowel Disease Obstruction Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._A designation used to segregate study subjects into collections in order to balance the study for analysis. The stratum group is made up of a combination of stratification criterion answers, which ultimately is used to assign study subjects to arms on a study._The study subject is enrolled._Used to describe the possession, relationships, or the state of something or someone._A spectrum of small and large bowel inflammatory diseases of unknown etiology. It includes Crohn's disease, ulcerative colitis, and colitis of indeterminate type._Blockage of the normal flow of the contents of an anatomical passageway._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Stratum Group Study Subject Enrolled Have Inflammatory Bowel Disease Obstruction Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: A designation used to segregate study subjects into collections in order to balance the study for analysis. The stratum group is made up of a combination of stratification criterion answers, which ultimately is used to assign study subjects to arms on a study.:Status assigned to a subject who agrees to participate in a study,  following completion of the informed consent process and meeting inclusion criteria. NOTE: Enrollment routinely requires verification of eligibility and inclusion in the analysis database. [after Clinicaltrials.gov]. NOTE: A less common definition assigns enrolled status is the point of enrollment, Can be defined from the signing of an informed consent form. Other ways of defining enrollment or subject status can be specified in some protocols, e.g. non-interventional studies. See also informed consent.:Used to describe the possession, relationships, or the state of something or someone.:A spectrum of small and large bowel inflammatory diseases of unknown etiology. It includes Crohn's disease, ulcerative colitis, and colitis of indeterminate type.:Blockage of the normal flow of the contents of an anatomical passageway.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: A designation used to segregate study subjects into collections in order to balance the study for analysis. The stratum group is made up of a combination of stratification criterion answers, which ultimately is used to assign study subjects to arms on a study.
Used to describe the possession, relationships, or the state of something or someone.
A spectrum of small and large bowel inflammatory diseases of unknown etiology. It includes Crohn's disease, ulcerative colitis, and colitis of indeterminate type.
Blockage of the normal flow of the contents of an anatomical passageway.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: COG CRF:Children's Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is enrolled under Stratum 1, 2, or 3, does patient have chronic inflammatory bowel disease and/or bowel obstruction?
